intro: Pleurospermum dentatum var. erosum, commonly known as the toothed pleurospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in umbels, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
